data.text:
@sorelle_bo @7NewsPerth Answer on the last one stands.  Again. Not exclusive to the covid vax and you are clearly nkt capable of undeestanding the workings of all vaccine reactions or the difference with a global emergency release. 
Harp to someone else about shit that was known a year ago seriously.

@sorelle_bo @7NewsPerth Okay dude. You realise this is on EVERY vaccine ever. Anaphylaxis is an allergy reaction and because vaccines aren't tested specifically against all illnesses some react badly. 
This is not NEW news. This is as old as vaccines themselves and aren't  exclusive to the covid vax.
@Stacey53538498 @7NewsPerth I’ll just leave this here https://t.co/AvEEO91ANz

@sorelle_bo @7NewsPerth I trust it. I don't trust it for my childrens health  issues which are a genetic make up not just an illness. Basic things interact badly so I'm waiting for a higher level of testing for the reasons of the chromosome mutations. Not because they are children.

@sorelle_bo @7NewsPerth Children like my son with a chromosome mutation/trisomy 10q which is rare as it is and can interact badly. 

But arguing for it to be reported about as you are. It already had been.  Over a year ago. You are very late to that party mate.

@sorelle_bo @7NewsPerth No no. Dont twist that. I did say it works. I said the news you were presenting is known and has already reported. You argued the point and I explained what the difference is for an emergency release vaccine. I also said emergenct release is riskier and not particularly great for
@Stacey53538498 @7NewsPerth So you’re telling me that you don’t fully trust this vaccine but here you are saying this vaccine works? That’s been my whole point all a long.

@sorelle_bo @7NewsPerth Because the reasoning behind it in numbers is valid. As it was with Polio and meningococcal. Personally I am waiting for my children.. one pf which has trisomy 10q.. rare as hell and no one knows much about it let alone how a vax would interact. Otherwise they'd be vaxxed.
